criteriaResults.criterion: Create `sql/schema-mysql.sql` for production environment (MySQL)
Create `sql/schema-sqlite.sql` for development environment (SQLite)
Both schemas must create identical table structures with dialect-appropriate syntax
Create `t_asset` base table with all common fields (id, asset_code, asset_name, asset_type, project_id, status, etc.)
Create extension tables: `t_asset_house`, `t_asset_parking`, `t_asset_facility`, `t_asset_venue`, `t_asset_office`
Create `t_asset_attachment` for file attachments
Create maintenance tables: `t_asset_maint_order`, `t_asset_maint_log`
Create code generation tables: `t_asset_code_rule`, `t_asset_code_seq`
Create P1 table: `t_asset_maint_plan` for maintenance scheduling
Add appropriate indexes: `(project_id, asset_type, status)`, `asset_code` unique
Add foreign key constraints where applicable
Include audit fields: `create_by`, `create_time`, `update_by`, `update_time`, `del_flag`
MySQL schema uses: `AUTO_INCREMENT`, `DATETIME`, `TINYINT(1)` for boolean, `ENGINE=InnoDB`
SQLite schema uses: `INTEGER PRIMARY KEY` (auto-increment), `TEXT` for datetime, `INTEGER` for boolean
SQLite schema includes `PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;` at the beginning
